thread.title: Tyrone Mings wasn't at all subtle after Marcos Rojo ESCAPES punishment for FA Cup stamp
thread.title_full: Tyrone Mings wasn't at all subtle after Marcos Rojo ESCAPES punishment for FA Cup stamp

author: Mark Jones
title: Tyrone Mings wasn't at all subtle after Marcos Rojo ESCAPES punishment for FA Cup stamp
text:
Sport Tyrone Mings wasn't at all subtle after Marcos Rojo ESCAPES punishment for FA Cup stamp The Bournemouth defender was handed a five-match ban for a similar offence AGAINST United recently, and he clearly hasn't forgotten Share Spot the difference (Photo: Sky Sports) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Maybe he'd just read a funny tweet. Maybe a particularly good cat video had just made his way onto his news feed. Maybe it was something else. We'll NEVER know. 
But Tyrone Mings sent an interesting tweet on Tuesday night. 
Well, we say interesting. It actually comprised of just three letters. Lol. 
But those three letters MIGHT have signified an awful lot. And you probably know why. Very subtle, Tyrone (Photo: Twitter / @OfficialTM_3) 
Mings' tweet appeared in the immediate aftermath of the news that Manchester United defender Marcos Rojo WON'T be facing an FA probe into an allegation that he stamped on Chelsea's Eden Hazard in the FA Cup clash on Monday night. 
That's WON'T be. Ouch (Photo: BBC) 
Because Rojo's offence looked mightily similar to Mings' stamp on the Argentinean's team-mate Zlatan Ibrahimovic in the Premier League 10 days ago, an offence for which Mings is currently serving a five-match ban. Zlatan's face being used as a doormat (Photo: Sky Sports) 
Granted, Mings went for Zlatan's head and Rojo seemed to be going for Hazard's chest, but still. Both were body parts connected to an opposition player, but obviously both have been met with drastically different results. 
Which is clearly something worth 'lolling' about if you're Mings. Or not. 
Maybe it was a cat video after all? poll loading Does Tyrone Mings deserve his five-game ban? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
